title: Malta
excerpt: An island nation in the Mediterranean Sea
text: Malta is an island nation in the central Mediterranean Sea, consisting of three inhabited islands: Malta, Gozo, and Comino. Valletta, the capital, is known as one of Europe's most densely populated cities and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Malta has a population of about 540,000 and is known for its beaches, historic sites, and warm climate. The country has a rich history influenced by Phoenician, Roman, Arab, Norman, and British cultures. Malta joined the European Union in 2004 and adopted the Euro in 2008. The islands are known for their limestone cliffs, turquoise waters, and Mediterranean sunshine. Malta's historical sites include ancient temples and the Great Siege of 1565.
